page.title: 01GREAT MEOLS-"URBAN VILLAGE."
page.content: Great Meols is a suburban settlement on the west coast,part of the{ {Wirral Peninsula.}Its name is Norse in origin-Meols-a sandhill.As"Melas"it was mentioned in the first Domesday Survey.Due to ribbon development the village has merged with nearby townships. The township is served by a{Primary {School,}several {churches,}retail outlets and public house. There are limited local leisure facilities and many residents commute for employment and recreational activities;the area being linked by road and rail to N.W.conurbations. {Clubs}and{societies}abound-eg.{Cubs, {Brownies, Guides,Scouts + Boy's Brig. Originally a fishing,farming community Meols has developed as a residential area;some original{cottages}remaining. At low tide a{submerged forest is}seen
